article_title: Local Giants fans gather in Palo Alto for World Series viewings
article_text:
Enthusiastic San Francisco Giants baseball fans gathered at Antonio’s Nut House in Palo Alto on Oct. 28 to watch the Giants play the Kansas City Royals in Game 6 of the World Series.

Giants starter Jake Peavy was knocked out of the game early and the Giants offense struggled to get anything going against Royals starter Yordano Ventura and company. The Giants were waxed 10-0, forcing a decisive Game 7. The series is tied 3-3. Tim Hudson will take the hill Oct. 29 against former Stanford pitcher Jeremy Guthrie at 5:07 p.m. Pacific.

og.description: Fans went nuts at Antonio's Nut House in Palo Alto for the San Francisco Giants, who lost Game 6 of the World Series on Oct. 28 to the Kansas City Royals.
og.title: Local Giants fans gather in Palo Alto for World Series viewings - Peninsula Press

Giants starter Jake Peavy was knocked out of the game early and the Giants offense struggled to get anything going against Royals starter Yordano Ventura and company.
Enthusiastic San Francisco Giants baseball fans gathered at Antonio’s Nut House in Palo Alto on Oct. 28 to watch the Giants play the Kansas City Royals in Game 6 of the World Series.
The Giants were waxed 10-0, forcing a decisive Game 7.
Tim Hudson will take the hill Oct. 29 against former Stanford pitcher Jeremy Guthrie at 5:07 p.m. Pacific.
The series is tied 3-3.
